intro: Harpachne schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions. Harpachne schimperi is often found in rocky areas and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
